lead_paragraph: Test your math skills with today's question, created by Patrick Honner at Math for America from the Times article "Unions Yield on Wage Scales to Preserve Jobs."
snippet: If someone works 40 hours per week, 50 weeks per year, what is the approximate yearly difference in income between the two pay scales described in this problem?
abstract: If someone works 40 hours per week, 50 weeks per year, what is the approximate yearly difference in income between the two pay scales described in this problem?
